gurmukhi: hwiQ rihE min ko Dir kY iqn nYk n kwhU kI Er inhwirE ] l`jq h√çY iKisXwno Gno duibDw kir Dwm kI Er isDwirE ]
transliteration: Haath(i) Rahio Man(i) Ko Dhar(i) Kai Tin Naik Na Kaahoo Kior Nihaario|| Lajjat Hvai Khisiyaano Ghano Doubidhaa Kar(i) Dhaam Kior Sidhaario||
translation: He took the jewel in his hand and without seeing towards anyone and feeling ashamed, left for his home in embarrassment;

gurmukhi: bYr pirXo hmro hir sau AO klMk cVXo gXo BRwqr mwirE ] BIr prI qy ADIr BXo duihqw dyau sXwm iehI icq DwirE ]2063]
transliteration: Bair Pariyo Hamro Har(i) Sau Au Kalank Chadyo Gyo Bhraatar Maario|| Bheer Parite Adheer Bhayo Duhitaa Deo Syaam Ehichit Dhaario||2063||
translation: Now Krishna has become my enemy and this is a blemish for me, but alongwith it my brother has also been killed; I have been entrapped in a difficult sitation, therefore now I should offer my daughter to Krishna.2063.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm iskMD purwxy bic`qR nwtky kiRSnvqwry sqRwijq ko mnI dIbo ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sikandh Puraane Bachittra Naatke Krishanvatdare Satraajit Ko Manideebo||
translation: End of the description about giving the jewel to Satrajit in Krishnavatara (based on Dasham Skandh Purana) in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: sqRwijq kI duihqw ko bXwh kQnM ]
translation: Now begins the description of the Marriage of the Daughter of Satrajit

gurmukhi: bol idjoqm bydn kI ibD jYs khI qs bXwh rcwXo ] siqBwmn ko kib sXwm BnY ijh ko sB logn mY jsu CwXo ]
transliteration: Bol Dijotan Bedan Kibidh Jais Kahitas Byaah Rachadyo|| Sat(i)bhaamanndko Kabi Syaam Bhanai Jih Ko Sabh Logad Mai Jas(u) Chhaado||
translation: Calling the Brahmins, Satrajit made arrangements for marriage of his daughter according to the Vedic ceremonies; the name of his daughter was Satyabhama, whose praise had been spread amongst all the people;

gurmukhi: pwvq hY aupmw lCmI kI n qw sm XO kihbo bin AwXo ] qwhI ky bXwhn kwj su dY min mwn BlY GinsXwm bulwXo ]2064]
transliteration: Paavat Hai Oupmaa Lachhmikina Taa Sam Yau Kahibo Ban(i) Aayo|| Taahike Byaahn Kaaj Su Dai Man(i) Maan Bhalai Ghan(i)syaam Bulaayo||2064||
translation: Even Lakshmi was not like her; Krishna was invited with respect in order to wed her.2064.

gurmukhi: sRI biRjnwQ suny bqIXw suB kwj jnyq qhwN ko isDwey ] Awvq so suin kY pRB ko sB Awgy hI qy imilby hI kau Dwey ]
transliteration: Sribrijnaath Soune Bateeyaa Soubh Kaaj Janet Tahaan Ko Sidhaae|| Oovat So Soun(i) Kai Prabh Ko Sabh Aage Hite Mil(i)be Hikau Dhaae||
translation: Receiving this new, Krishna went with the marriage party towards her; knowing about the impending arrival of the Lord, all the people reached to welcome him;

gurmukhi: Awdr sMg lvwie kY jwie ibvwh kIXo idjdwn idvwey ] AYsy ibvwh pRBU suK pwie qRIXw sMg lY kir Dwmih Awey ]2065]
transliteration: Oodar San Lavaae Kai Jaae Bivaah Keeyo Dijdaan Divaae|| Aise Bivaah Prabhoo Soukh Paae Treeyaa San Lai Kar(i) Dhaamah(i) Aae||2065||
translation: He was taken reverently for the nuptial ceremonies; the Brahmins were given the gifts; Krishna returned to his home happily after the marriage.2065.
End of the completion of the marriage ceremonies.
Now begins the description of the episode of the House of Wax
